personal.name: Shammi Parussella
personal.title: Graduate Software Engineer | Data Analyst | IT Support
personal.summary: Results-driven Computer Science graduate with hands-on experience in software engineering, data analysis, and IT support. Adept at collaborating in team environments, delivering technical solutions, and supporting business operations. Passionate about leveraging technology to solve real-world problems.
personal.elevator_pitch: I am a recent Computer Science graduate with a strong foundation in software development, data analytics, and IT support. My experience spans academic projects, internships, and professional roles where I have demonstrated adaptability, problem-solving, and a commitment to continuous learning.

salary_location.remote_experience: Experienced with remote and hybrid work environments, using collaboration tools like Teams and Slack.
salary_location.travel_availability: Available for interstate travel as required

experience.title: Software Engineering Intern
experience.company_context: Research and development internship focused on digital twin systems and AI integration.
experience.team_structure: Collaborated with academic supervisors and a multidisciplinary team.

achievements_star.situation: Developing an AI-powered digital twin for interview preparation.
achievements_star.task: Design and implement a RAG system with vector database integration.
achievements_star.action: Built a digital twin MCP server in Python, integrated Upstash Vector DB, implemented Groq API for LLM, and created an embedding pipeline for personal data.
achievements_star.result: Deployed a working digital twin system that answers interview questions with context-aware responses.

experience.title: IT Support Analyst (Internship)
experience.company_context: Tasmanian electricity transmission and distribution company.
experience.team_structure: Worked in a cross-functional IT support team.

achievements_star.situation: Supporting end-users with technical issues and system upgrades.
achievements_star.task: Provide IT support, troubleshoot hardware/software, and assist with system rollouts.
achievements_star.action: Resolved tickets, configured devices, and contributed to documentation and process improvement.
achievements_star.result: Improved user satisfaction and reduced ticket resolution times.

experience.title: Customer Service Team Member
experience.team_structure: Worked in a large, customer-facing team.

achievements_star.situation: High-volume retail environment requiring excellent customer service.
achievements_star.task: Assist customers, manage transactions, and maintain store standards.
achievements_star.action: Provided friendly service, handled cash and EFTPOS, and supported team operations.
achievements_star.result: Consistently received positive feedback and contributed to team targets.

education.degree: Bachelor of Information and Communication Technology (BICT)
education.thesis_project: Digital Twin Systems for Interview Preparation

projects_portfolio.name: Digital Twin MCP Server
projects_portfolio.description: AI-powered interview preparation system using RAG architecture. Built MCP server to store and retrieve professional information using vector embeddings for context-aware responses.
projects_portfolio.impact: Enabled intelligent interview preparation with personalized, context-aware responses.

projects_portfolio.name: RAG Food Workshop
projects_portfolio.description: Retrieval-Augmented Generation system for food-related queries and recommendations.
projects_portfolio.impact: Learned foundational RAG concepts and vector database implementation.

career_goals.short_term: Secure a graduate software engineering or data analyst role.
career_goals.long_term: Progress to a technical lead or specialist in AI-powered applications.

behavioral.question: Tell me about a time you had to learn a new technology quickly.
behavioral.answer: During my UTAS internship, I had to quickly learn about vector databases and RAG architecture. I read documentation, built a simple project, and then implemented a full digital twin system using Upstash and Groq.

behavioral.question: Describe a challenging technical problem you solved.
behavioral.answer: I resolved a tricky bug in the embedding pipeline by systematically debugging, checking logs, and consulting documentation, which improved my troubleshooting skills.

technical.question: Explain how you implemented the RAG system in your digital twin project.
technical.answer: I structured my data in JSON, generated embeddings with sentence transformers, stored them in Upstash Vector, and used Groq LLM for context-aware responses.

technical.question: What's your experience with APIs and integration?
technical.answer: I've integrated REST APIs (Groq, Upstash), handled authentication, and built endpoints using FastAPI.

situational.question: How would you approach learning a new codebase?
situational.answer: I start with documentation, explore the project structure, run the application, and make small changes to understand the flow.

preparation_questions: What excites you about our company?
Why do you want to work here?
questions_to_ask: What technologies does the team use?

weakness_mitigation.mitigation: Building production-ready projects and following best practices.

weakness_mitigation.weakness: Early in my career with team collaboration experience
weakness_mitigation.mitigation: Demonstrated teamwork in internships and retail roles.
